tests.name: Code Coverage - Training Files
tests.run: npx vitest --run --coverage --coverage.include='src/Components/Training-Files/**/*.tsx' --coverage.include='src/Components/Training-Files/**/*.ts' --coverage.exclude='**/*.test.*' && node -e "const fs = require('fs'); if (!fs.existsSync('./coverage/coverage-summary.json')) { console.log('Coverage file not found'); process.exit(0); } const coverage = require('./coverage/coverage-summary.json'); const trainingFiles = Object.keys(coverage).filter(k => k.includes('Training-Files') && !k.includes('.test.')); if (trainingFiles.length === 0) { console.log('No training files found in coverage'); process.exit(0); } let totalLines = 0, coveredLines = 0; trainingFiles.forEach(f => { if (coverage[f] && coverage[f].lines) { totalLines += coverage[f].lines.total; coveredLines += coverage[f].lines.covered; } }); const pct = totalLines > 0 ? (coveredLines / totalLines) * 100 : 0; console.log('Training Files Coverage: ' + pct.toFixed(2) + '%'); if (pct < 60) { process.exit(1); }"

tests.name: No Console Statements - Training Files
tests.run: CONSOLE_COUNT=$(grep -r "console\." src/Components/Training-Files --include="*.tsx" --include="*.ts" --exclude="*.test.*" 2>/dev/null | grep -v "catch" | wc -l | tr -d ' ' || echo "0") && if [ "$CONSOLE_COUNT" -gt 0 ]; then echo "Found $CONSOLE_COUNT console statements in Training Files"; exit 1; fi && echo "No console statements found"
